title: Establishing an America First Arms Transfer Strategy
summary: Executive Order 14383 establishes an "America First Arms Transfer Strategy" to leverage U.S. military equipment's global dominance for foreign policy and domestic production expansion. The strategy aims to use foreign purchases to build U.S. production capacity, strengthen the defense industrial base, and ensure technological superiority. Key policies include intentionally using arms transfers as a foreign policy tool, streamlining inter-agency processes for defense sales, and prioritizing sales to partners who invest in their own defense or play a critical role in U.S. operations. The order mandates the creation of a sales catalog of prioritized platforms, enhanced advocacy for U.S. defense exports, and identification of Foreign Military Sales (FMS) and Direct Commercial Sales opportunities. It also directs actions to eliminate inefficiencies in arms transfers by improving end-use monitoring, reviewing third-party transfer processes, providing advanced notice for contracting actions, and ensuring coordination in assessing direct commercial sales impacts. Furthermore, it establishes the "Promoting American Military Sales Task Force" to coordinate strategy implementation, enhance accountability, and improve transparency, including the publication of aggregate quarterly performance metrics on FMS case development and export license adjudication.
